ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Yes

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Enjoyed Mary Evelyn's expertise, Swearer and Miller's writings, and the Dekila Chungyalpa interviews.
The on-line assignments, interacting with others on-line, in-class discussions. The on-line lectures were also good.
It's amazing to look into the complicated religions from a specific and precise perspective. People are thereby able to touch the core of the wisdom of the religions and understand them step by step.
These extremely great teachings make me refreshed

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The timing of the "flipped course" format is tough. With class not until late on Wednesday, I hate that I have to have all the readings and postings done by the preceding weekend. By the time class rolls around, the material is no longer fresh in my mind. I also hate to get too far ahead and mix up course materials, so I don't move to the next module until after class. That leaves me with only a couple days each week where I can realistically do the work, leaving me feeling crammed and rushed every weekend.

It is difficult to retain the material, at least it is for me. This is particularly true in a week with multiple readings and multiple on-line lectures. Perhaps a set of brief study questions for the readings?
Maybe the discussion time.
NA

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Discussions and lectures were directly related.
The discussions are really important for providing a space for interaction between eastern and western thoughts.
Great

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: One of my strong interests is the relationship of religion/faith/spirituality to ecology/natural sciences/environmental studies. This course is a very good fit.
That's definitely what I desire from my program.
Very well. These help me understand how to better practice ecological methods based on the mutual understanding of the people and nature

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To repeat: One of my strong interests is the relationship of religion/faith/spirituality to ecology/natural sciences/environmental studies. This course is a very good fit.
As the last answer.
Very interested in East Asia culture

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes

Yes, for the most part. I m not sure I will retain the concepts to the degree I would like to. Perhaps the onus there is on me to work at retaining and strengthening what I gained from the course. I am wondering if the course could be strengthened in some way to assist.
More than my expectations.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Group work was done via commenting on each others' posts and via in class discussions. These were among the strongest learning experiences in the course.
NA

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: If you are interested AT ALL in religion and ecology or in a variety of religious traditions, take the class. Make time for the readings... and for thinking about them. Also make time for the on-line lectures, which are very good. Put a lot of effort into your weekly on-line posts.
Please read the discussions online carefully because there will be many great comments.
Yes, you will enjoy this class
